parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Unique ID of object or group.  As this command is MP only, you can use [[BIS_fnc_netId]], which extends the use to SP as well. See also: [[BIS_fnc_objectVar]]

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''netId''' var

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> var: [[Object]] or [[Group]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_playerNetId = [[netId]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[objectFromNetId]], [[groupFromNetId]], [[BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId]], [[BIS_fnc_netId]], [[BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId]], [[BIS_fnc_objectVar]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 19, 2018 - 13:40 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:demellion|demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''NOTE:''' Even if the returned value is in format of '''owner:uniqueid''', it doesn't follow the current ownership of an object ([[owner]] for example). 
<br>This command keeps the '''original owner''' of a created object.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
